code: @Manual{,   title = {rapidcycler: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN},   author = {Benjamin Atkins},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.0},   url = {https://global-vaccine-data-network.github.io/rapidcycler/}, }

what: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
text: goal rapidcycler bring together number methodologies functions used perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA). current version package includes functionality validate aggregate line list data de-identified format sharing GVDN. also additional functionality produce synthetic line list data, though thoroughly tested used illustrative/testing purposes. Future versions include functions perform sequential analysis using maximised sequential probability ratio tests (MaxSPRT), visualise results, produce reports. Shiny app also planned aid regular communication results. Sites required use functions, analysis dissemination results performed GVDN, however provided transparency sites may

title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
text: can install rapidcycler two ways:

title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
text: unable connect GitHub within working environment, method use. single zipped file (tarball) made available download import environment. contain source code package, can opened checked, however edited. saved environment, package can installed following command: update package, process downloading, importing, installing tarball must repeated.
code: # EDIT THE FILE PATH AND NAME AS NECESSARY install.packages("~/Documents/rapidcycler_1.0.0.0.tar.gz", repos = NULL, type="source")

title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN

title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
text: several R packages need installed installing rapidcycler: clock data.table dplyr fst magrittr rlang stringr

title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
text: package split 6 main parts, separate purpose: Aggregate: aggregate line list data appropriate, de-identified format sharing Validate: validate input datasets performing aggregation Generate: generate synthetic input data testing illustrative purposes Configure (expected future version) Analyse (expected future version) Visualise (expected future version)

title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
text: participate RCA, sites required interact aggregation part package. functionalities used GVDN perform analyses report results, however provided sites make use wish (expected future version). primary function aggregation aggregate_data(). can view full documentation using ?aggregate_data help("aggregate_data"). key things note: Requires input data format described data dictionary output templates, summarised next section. vaccination_data input set NULL, function perform historical data aggregation. input datasets saved removed global environment aggregation, restored afterwards default (see restore_input_data parameter). can also restored manually using recombine_input_data() function. aggregation complete, saved versions input datasets deleted. like store input datasets used, please manually whilst still global environment. Validation input datasets run automatically aggregation started. issues found, aggregation aborted issues printed console. issues need fixed aggregation can completed. Validation can also run separately - see Advanced usage section end document. output function, however create new folder name format “RCA_[STUDY_CODENMAE][SITE_CODE][CYCLE_START]-[CYCLE_END]”, location specified working_directory, save aggregated tables within . complete, folder zipped sent GVDN. Requires ‘options.txt’ file run - sent GVDN saved appropriate location (specified options_file_location). file used duration study (one options file per study module).

title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
text: 7 required inputs function, several optional inputs revert default specified. code create new folder current working directory, given getwd(). must also ‘options.txt’ file saved location.
code: # Assuming patient_data, vaccination_data, and outcome_data are data.table objects already loaded into the global environment aggregate_data(patient_data, vaccination_data, outcome_data,                cycle_start_date = as.Date("2022-01-01"),                cycle_end_date = as.Date("2022-01-31"),                site_code = "TEST_SITE",                participation_level = 3)

title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
text: two important file locations within function: options_file_location: ‘options.txt’ file stored working_directory: new folder created, within aggregated tables saved inputs default current working directory, given getwd(), specified. use different location, can either change current working directory using setwd() (locations ), use inputs specify different locations (need match, recommended folder structure ).
code: # Assuming patient_data, vaccination_data, and outcome_data are data.table objects already loaded into the global environment aggregate_data(patient_data, vaccination_data, outcome_data,                cycle_start_date = as.Date("2022-01-01"),                cycle_end_date = as.Date("2022-01-31"),                site_code = "TEST_SITE",                participation_level = 3,                options_file_location = "~/Documents/RCA_COVID/",                working_directory = "~/Documents/RCA_COVID/")

title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
text: find running RAM execution aggregate_data() function, execution slow, can restrict amount data aggregated one time using split_size input. function splits input data portions size split_size according PID, stores split datasets subfolder called ‘data’, aggregates one split time, recombines performs final aggregation splits complete. default 500,000, lowered memory issue. large amounts RAM, increasing split size may also speed aggregation. NOTE: still input whole datasets - function handle splitting .
code: # Assuming patient_data, vaccination_data, and outcome_data are data.table objects already loaded into the global environment aggregate_data(patient_data, vaccination_data, outcome_data,                cycle_start_date = as.Date("2022-01-01"),                cycle_end_date = as.Date("2022-01-31"),                site_code = "TEST_SITE",                participation_level = 3,                 split_size = 100000)

title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
text: NOTE: use method input datasets large possible load R one go. , can divide data chunks aggregating. , must specify input_data_in_chunks = TRUE. data divided chunks PID, records associated person included chunk. temporary results chunk stored last chunk aggregated (specified using final_chunk = TRUE), temporary results combined final aggregation performed. case, need call aggregate_data() function multiple times. time, pass single chunk dataset, therefore, requires loading new chunk input data (either saved file directly database) function call. example assumes input datasets split 2 chunks, exists code retrieve chunks saved file directly database. IMPORTANT - combine fully aggregated tables together, produce correctly aggregated tables. Dealing input data chunks must performed way described
code: patient_data_chunk1 <- load_patient_data_chunk1() vaccination_data_chunk1 <- load_vaccination_data_chunk1 outcome_data_chunk1 <- load_outcome_data_chunk1  aggregate_data(patient_data_chunk1, vaccination_data_chunk1, outcome_data_chunk1,                cycle_start_date = as.Date("2022-01-01"),                cycle_end_date = as.Date("2022-01-31"),                site_code = "TEST_SITE",                participation_level = 3,                 input_data_in_chunks = TRUE,                final_chunk = FALSE) # FALSE until final chunk  # Remove data from memory (can also do this automatically by setting 'restore_input_data = FALSE' in function call) rm("patient_data_chunk1", "vaccination_data_chunk1", "outcome_data_chunk1")  patient_data_chunk2 <- load_patient_data_chunk2() vaccination_data_chunk2 <- load_vaccination_data_chunk2 outcome_data_chunk2 <- load_outcome_data_chunk2  aggregate_data(patient_data_chunk2, vaccination_data_chunk2, outcome_data_chunk2,                cycle_start_date = as.Date("2022-01-01"),                cycle_end_date = as.Date("2022-01-31"),                site_code = "TEST_SITE",                participation_level = 3,                 input_data_in_chunks = TRUE,                final_chunk = TRUE) # TRUE to trigger final aggregation  # Remove data from memory (can also do this automatically by setting 'restore_input_data = FALSE' in function call) rm("patient_data_chunk2", "vaccination_data_chunk2", "outcome_data_chunk2")

title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
text: possible stop aggregation restart later time. can stop aggregation manually interrupting execution, using stop_after_n_splits input. Either way, aggregation can resumed stopped. Note , stop aggregation manually interrupting execution, input datasets restored global environment afterwards. However, saved ‘data’ subfolder (split format) ready resumption, can restored global environment using recombine_input_data() function. example stop aggregation 2 splits input datasets aggregated (note, aggregate splits across time periods study designs). simplest way resume aggregation using resume_cycle_aggregation() function:
code: # Assuming patient_data, vaccination_data, and outcome_data are data.table objects already loaded into the global environment aggregate_data(patient_data, vaccination_data, outcome_data,                cycle_start_date = as.Date("2022-01-01"),                cycle_end_date = as.Date("2022-01-31"),                site_code = "TEST_SITE",                participation_level = 3,                 stop_after_n_splits = 2) resume_cycle_aggregation(folder_name = "RCA_COVID_TEST_SITE_20220101-20220131",                           working_directory = "~/Documents/RCA_COVID/")  # NOTE: also optional arguments stop_after_n_splits, input_data_in_chunks, and final_chunk, that behave in the same way as previously described

title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
text: full data dictionary can found : https://uoa.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/sites/globalvaccinedatanetwork/Shared%20Documents/GCoVS%20Project/2.%20Rapid%20Cycle%20Analyses/RCA%20II%20(2024)?csf=1&web=1&e=6zgf7A input datasets following structures: patient_data vaccination_data outcome_data

title: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN
text: explanations examples relating functionalities within package, please see included vignettes. can browse vignettes using browseVignettes("rapidcycler").

title: Aggregate line list datasets — aggregate_data
text: function take input datasets create folder containing aggregated tables separate csv files, depending participation level. separate folder created cycle period. Aggregation can stopped resumed (see resume_cycle_aggregation() function). trigger historical data aggregation (.e. vaccinations began), set vaccination_data = NULL. Requires 'options.txt' file run - sent GVDN. Validation input datasets automatically run part function, throw error finds issues require fixing. like run validation separately, use validate_input_data() function.

title: Aggregate line list datasets — aggregate_data
code: aggregate_data(   patient_data,   vaccination_data,   outcome_data,   cycle_start_date,   cycle_end_date,   site_code,   participation_level,   options_file_location = getwd(),   options = NULL,   suppression_limit = NULL,   split_size = 5e+05,   stop_after_n_splits = NULL,   restore_input_data = TRUE,   working_directory = getwd(),   input_data_in_chunks = FALSE,   final_chunk = FALSE )

title: Aggregate line list datasets — aggregate_data
text: patient_data Patient data input data.table vaccination_data Vaccination data input data.table. Set NULL perform historical data aggregation outcome_data AESI outcome data input data.table cycle_start_date Start date cycle, date object, 8 digit number form yyyymmdd, string form yyyy-mm-dd cycle_end_date End date cycle, date object, 8 digit number form yyyymmdd, string form yyyy-mm-dd site_code Site code (e.g. AUS_MCRI), string participation_level Site's level participation, number 1-3: 1 = minimal, 2 = partial, 3 = full options_file_location Location options.txt file stored. Supply either options_file_location options, . Defaults getwd() options Options object, already converted txt file. Supply either options_file_location options, suppression_limit required, low numbers can suppressed. Numbers less limit suppressed split_size Input data automatically split pieces size (default 500,000). memory issue, lower split_size. Aggregation done split data separately, combined splits complete. Aggregation can stopped restarted last completed split (see resume_cycle_aggregation() function) stop_after_n_splits Use stop aggregation given number splits. Aggregation can resumed later date (see resume_cycle_aggregation() function) restore_input_data TRUE (default) input data restored data folder global environment aggregation complete, stop_after_n_splits reached. FALSE, input data restored. WARNING: data folder removed aggregation complete (stopped using stop_after_n_splits) working_directory Location working directory. folder cycle created. Defaults getwd(). input_data_in_chunks Option pre-split input data. use data large load R one go (otherwise just use split_size) final_chunk pre-split input data, use indicate running last chunk input data. trigger function combine temporary results end

what: Aggregate data with concurrent comparators — aggregate_data_concurrent
title: Aggregate data with concurrent comparators — aggregate_data_concurrent
text: Aggregate risk/control AESI counts ratio according concurrent study designs, within given period time.

title: Aggregate data with concurrent comparators — aggregate_data_concurrent
code: aggregate_data_concurrent(   patient_data,   vaccination_data,   outcome_data,   period_start,   period_end,   options,   comparator = "vaccinated",   allow_side_effects = FALSE,   analysis_types = NULL,   return_preaggregated = FALSE )

title: Aggregate data with concurrent comparators — aggregate_data_concurrent
text: patient_data Patient data input data.table period_start Start date period, date object. Period lengths defined options file, cycle possibly containing multiple periods. single period aggregated time. period_end End date period, date object. Period lengths defined options file, cycle possibly containing multiple periods. single period aggregated time. options Options object, already converted txt file. comparator Specify whether 'vaccinated' 'unvaccinated' comparator group used allow_side_effects Whether changes made original input data allowed persist function completed. analysis_types Character vector defining primary sub-analyses included study (options file) return_preaggregated Due calculation ratios assignment controls, two fully aggregated tables can combined study design. TRUE, function combine risk/control groups calculate ratio, instead return objects separately list. allows majority aggregation performed stages, combining calculating ratio end (using concurrent_final_aggregation() function)

title: Aggregate data with concurrent comparators — aggregate_data_concurrent
text: return_preaggregated = FALSE, returns data.table object matching 'Concurrent - Vac' 'Concurrent - Unvac' templates. return_preaggregated = TRUE, returns list four data.table objects corresponding control/risk counts control/risk groups, required produce final table.

what: rapidcycler: Perform Rapid Cycle Analysis (RCA) for GVDN — rapidcycler-package

title: Recombine input datasets — recombine_input_data

title: Recombine input datasets — recombine_input_data
text: data_file_path Path 'data' folder split datasets stored patient_data_input_name Desired name patient_data object global environment, defaults "patient_data". Set NULL skip dataset. vaccination_data_input_name Desired name vaccination_data object global environment, defaults "vaccination_data". Set NULL skip dataset. outcome_data_input_name Desired name outcome_data object global environment, defaults "outcome_data". Set NULL skip dataset.

title: Resume data aggregation — resume_cycle_aggregation
text: folder_name Name main results folder cycle (including path) working_directory Location main results folder cycle (path ) stop_after_n_splits Use stop aggregation given number splits. Aggregation can resumed later date (). input_data_in_chunks Option pre-split input data. use data large load R one go (otherwise just use split_size). match used initial call aggregate_data(). final_chunk pre-split input data, use indicate running last chunk input data. trigger function combine temporary results end. match used initial call aggregate_data().

what: Validate input datasets before aggregating — validate_input_data
title: Validate input datasets before aggregating — validate_input_data
text: Checks input datasets obvious issues, including incorrect column names types, duplicated data, date ranges etc. function run automatically within aggregate_data() function, therefore need run manually (however possible wish ). validating historical input data, set vaccination_data = NULL.

title: Validate input datasets before aggregating — validate_input_data
code: validate_input_data(   patient_data,   vaccination_data,   outcome_data,   cycle_start_date,   cycle_end_date,   options_file_location = getwd(),   options = NULL,   split_size = 5e+05 )

title: Validate input datasets before aggregating — validate_input_data
text: patient_data Patient data input data.table vaccination_data Vaccination data input data.table. Set NULL perform historical data aggregation outcome_data AESI outcome data input data.table cycle_start_date Start date cycle, date object, 8 digit number form yyyymmdd, string form yyyy-mm-dd cycle_end_date End date cycle, date object, 8 digit number form yyyymmdd, string form yyyy-mm-dd options_file_location Location options.txt file stored. Supply either options_file_location options, . Defaults getwd() options Options object, already converted txt file. Supply either options_file_location options, split_size Input data automatically split pieces size (default 500,000). memory issue, lower split_size.
